The Peak Season Reality

For e-commerce fulfillment centers, logistics companies, and customer support operations, peak season (October–December) is both a blessing and a curse.

60% of annual revenue concentrated in 12 weeks

The Challenge You Face

Your phones blow up. Your chat queues explode. "Where is my order?" tickets multiply by 10x. Your 5-person team can't handle it. You have three options:

  • Option 1: Hire Contractors. Speed: Fast. Cost: $18–25/hr for temporary staff. Problem: They're untrained, they quit mid-season, and you're left scrambling.
  • Option 2: Hire Full-Time. Speed: Slow (weeks to recruit). Cost: $65k–90k/year locked in forever. Problem: In January, you have 45 people for work that needs 5.
  • Option 3: Partner with ZuZo. Speed: 3–5 days. Cost: Scale up and down monthly. Problem: None.
The math: Temporary hires cost you $144–300/day in wages + lost productivity + training overhead. ZuZo costs $5–8/day per additional agent.

The ZuZo Peak Season Scaling Model

Week-by-Week Ramp-Up (No Commitments)

September (Baseline): 5 agents, $0 additional cost
Week 1 October (Pre-Peak): Scale to 15 agents, test workflows
Week 2–3 October (Early Season): 30 agents, full operational load
Week 4 October–Week 4 November (Peak): 50 agents, maximum throughput
Week 1–2 December (Decline): Scale back to 25 agents
Week 3+ December (Post-Peak): Return to 5 agents

How It Works

We don't ask you to commit to 50 agents for 12 months. Instead, you scale up weekly based on your actual volume.

Monthly flexibility with zero long-term contracts. Cancel anytime after December. No penalties.

Implementation Timeline – Launch in 5 Days

Pre-Launch Preparation (Before October)

Document your current workflows (scripts, FAQs, escalation rules)
Share your ticketing system access (Zendesk, Freshdesk, Intercom)
Confirm your SLAs (response time, resolution time)
Identify your top 20 FAQ issues and responses

Launch Week (First Week of October)

  • Day 1–2: ZuZo recruits and onboards your first 10 Ghana-based agents
  • Day 3–4: Intensive training on your systems, tone, and workflows
  • Day 5: Go live with 15 agents; your team monitors and coaches

Ongoing Support

Weekly calibration calls ensure quality remains 4.5+ CSAT. Real-time escalation protocols keep your team engaged.

Your team sees a 70% reduction in daily workload while maintaining (or improving) customer satisfaction scores
